TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CharacterCasing extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the case of characters typed manually into a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of this enumeration does not affect characters that are added to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> programmatically.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox.CharacterCasing%2A> property to convert all characters to uppercase that are manually entered into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox>.
[!code-xaml[TextBoxMiscSnippets_snip#CharacterCasingExampleWholePage](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextBoxMiscSnippets_snip/csharp/charactercasingexample.xaml#charactercasingexamplewholepage)]
[!code-csharp[TextBoxMiscSnippets_procedural_snip#CharacterCasingCodeExampleWholePage](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextBoxMiscSnippets_procedural_snip/CSharp/CharacterCasingExample.cs#charactercasingcodeexamplewholepage)] [!code-vb[TextBoxMiscSnippets_procedural_snip#CharacterCasingCodeExampleWholePage](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextBoxMiscSnippets_procedural_snip/visualbasic/charactercasingexample.vb#charactercasingcodeexamplewholepage)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CharacterCasing Lower = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Characters typed into a are converted to lowercase.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CharacterCasing Normal = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Characters typed into a are not converted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CharacterCasing Upper = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Characters typed into a are converted to uppercase.
